meanings.definition: The trade or occupation of a carpenter.
meanings.sent1: My uncle has been involved in carpentries for many years.
meanings.sent2: The carpentries in our town are known for their high-quality work.
meanings.sent3: I tried my hand at carpentries, but ended up with more splinters than furniture.
meanings.sent4: The carpentries of the old master craftsman were like poetry in wood.
meanings.sent5: The smell of sawdust always reminds me of the carpentries my grandfather used to do.

meanings.definition: The work or products of a carpenter.
meanings.sent1: The carpentries displayed at the exhibition were truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: I admire the intricate details in these carpentries.
meanings.sent3: The carpentries in the shop looked like they were straight out of a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The carpentries in this house have stood the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The carpentries in the cabin were rustic yet charming.

meanings.definition: The skill or practice of working with wood.
meanings.sent1: Learning carpentries requires patience and precision.
meanings.sent2: She honed her carpentries under the guidance of a master woodworker.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at carpentries turned the garage into a sawdust-filled mess.
meanings.sent4: The art of carpentries is a blend of creativity and craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of carpentries lies in the transformation of raw wood into functional pieces.
